Shoreline.Piper Orchard:
Piper Orchard is a fruit orchard containing primarily heirloom apple trees, located within Seattle Washington's Carkeek Park.


== History ==


=== Early ===
The orchard was planted in what was then the homestead of notable Seattle settler A. W. Piper, sometime after the Great Seattle Fire of 1889 which destroyed the Pipers' downtown business, the Puget Sound Candy Factory.
The orchard is located on a hillside in what is now known as Piper Canyon, above Pipers Creek.
